Description: Complex necklace, formed with two strongs of beads. The upper one features gold and green glass beads, from which hang a series of gold drop-shaped pendants. The lower string bears cornelian, red jasper and blue glazed composition beads, from which hang cornflower-shaped pendants.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Biban el-Muluk (Valley of the Kings - Thebes)
Curator's comments: Published: James, BM Book of Flowers, (1989), p.25, fig.19. Andrews, Ancient Egyptian Jewellery, (1990), pl.27(b), p.36-7. The Treasures of the BM (Japanese exhibition), (1990-1), p.89. Strouhal, Life in Ancient Egypt, (1992), p.88, fig.90. Treasures of the BM, pl.75, p.90.
On cornflower beads, popular in the New Kingdom, see Patch in Roehrig, Hatshepsut (New York exhibition catalogue, 2005): 206–7 [125a–b].
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1990 20 Oct-9 Dec, Japan, Tokyo, Setagaya Art Museum, Treasures of the British Museum, cat. no.75 1991 5 Jan-20 Feb, Japan, Yamaguchi, Prefectural Museum of Art, Treasures of the British Museum, cat. no.75 1991 9 Mar-7 May, Japan, Osaka, National Museum of Art, Treasures of the British Museum, cat. no.75 2001 26 Jun-23 Sep, Birmingham Gas Hall, Egypt Revealed
Acquisition name: Donated by: Mrs Essie Winifred Newberry
